data.text:
How is your diet? The answer to this question is nearly always ‘It could be better’!

The key to a healthier diet is small steps – we can all start by making small changes, feeling the benefits, and then making more small changes. This is the formula!

data.value: What small change can you make next week? Take a look at the list of simple ideas below and then decide on 1 thing, from this list or elsewhere, to improve your energy through improved nutrition in the coming week.

items.label: Drink more water
items.sub_label: Staying hydrated is important for your health, mood, concentration and overall performance. Try to drink at least 8 glasses per day.

items.label: Eat less processed food
items.sub_label: They are often high in  sugar, "bad fats", refined carbohydrates and artificial additives, and at the same time low on energy, fiber and good nutrients!

items.label: Plan your meals ahead of time
items.sub_label: Decide what you will be eating before you get hungry. Hungry decisions are often poor decisions.

items.label: Eat out less
items.sub_label: Eating in restaurants is not only expensive but can also be less healthy than cooking at home. If you eat out a lot, try reducing this and see how you feel.

items.label: Reduce alcohol consumption
items.sub_label: This will improve your health, sleep, energy, mood and concentration.

items.label: Eat more fruits and vegetables
items.sub_label: The WHO recommends at least 5 portions of fruit and veg per day

items.label: Consume less caffeine
items.sub_label: Caffeine can cause anxiety, restlessness and trouble sleeping.

items.label: Improve snacking habits
items.sub_label: Remove unhealthy temptations and replace with healthy snacks

data.label: Write down an actionable idea to improve your energy levels through nutrition next week
data.name: idea_to_improve_nutrition
